Flags.Description: Used for the stego module, when the file you input does not exist and you use the command perl <imgformat> ex: perl PNG, this will be used to set the pixel height and width of the new image
Same thing as --ph however this is the width
Set a location chunk to inject data into a JPG image using the command perl JPG
Set a input file for hex dumping, loading, credential sniffing, logs, and more
Set a output filename for the stego modules, you would use this for anything like image injection that requires an output file
Set the meta tag to get metadata of a PNG image
Supress he chunk of hex data output when injecting PNG images
Specify the chunk offset location to inject data into a PNG image format
Specify the payload for image injection utility tools
Set the specific chunk to inject for png image formats

Specify a filepath for a filepath, an example usgae would be injecting a zip file, to do this you use the flags -i for the image to inject and --filepath /path/to/zip.zip to specify the zip file to inject into the image, then run the command 'inject zip' to inject the image
Spawn a help menu for flags
Spawn a general help menu
Specify your screen rotation for banner Type <Verticle|Landscape|>
Specify a hash list for hash brute forcing and matching
Specify a user list for brute forcing
Specify a wordlist for brute forcing
Set the amount of workers for brute forcing and hash matching
Specify the packet type to sniff for network sniffing modules -> ICMP, tcp, eth, ip, dhcmp, application, dot11 are the only formats supported
Specify the interface for modules that require one such as wifi sniffers and fake beacons
Set a target mac address for arp poisoning
Set a target IP address for arp poisoning
Set a target gateway mac address for arp poisoning
Set a range for host scanning EX '192.168.8.1/24'
